Subject Matter: 1. Seeking meeting with Heath Committee to share vapers exeriences at  Pre-legislative Scrutiny of Tobacco +Nicotine Bill. 2 Share London City University survey dispelling myth that flavoured vapes are gateway to smoking. 3. Share Red C survey that found that 96% of vapers in Ireland do not favour a ban on flavoured vapes. If introduced many would buy unregulated products online.
Intended Results: Share accurate research on vaping and its role in helping smokers quit cigarettes with Health Committee and all members of the Oireachtas .

Specific Details: Heart Failure Services
DPOs Lobbied: John Lahart|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Róisín Shorthall|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: Heart Failure Services
Intended Results: To secure information on plans to develop a Heart Failure Registry providing vital real-time information to help cut excessive mortality and hospital admission rates ::To secure information on plans to tackle the revolving door syndrome in heart failure treatment that has resulted in a 90-day readmission rate to hospital of 30% ::To secure information on plans to cut waiting times for outpatient appointments for heart failure patients, particularly in view of the high hospital readmission rates among patients with the condition ::To determine if the Minister for Health is aware of a pilot phone support programme run by the Irish Heart Foundation in conjunction with the heart failure service in University Hospital Waterford ::To establish how many hospitals provide a clinical psychology service to heart failure patients, those treating heart failure that have no dedicated service for these patients and if plans exist to improve these services ::To secure information on the cost and staffing that would be associated with expanding clinical psychology to all heart failure patients requiring a service
Lobbying Activities: |Email|6-10
